Class PasswordValidator

java.lang.Object
com.chrisceltin.password_validator.PasswordValidator
All Implemented Interfaces:
PasswordValidatorInterface
public class PasswordValidator extends Object implements PasswordValidatorInterface
The PasswordValidator class validates passwords based on specific rules defined in the PasswordValidatorInterface. The password must meet conditions such as containing a certain number of uppercase and lowercase letters, digits and one of the specified pet names.

The validation process returns a ValidationResult object containing the result of the validation and an appropriate message.

This class implements the PasswordValidatorInterface.

Version:
1.0.
Author:
Christine Gundel, Celine Hager, Tina Ranft.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      public ValidationResult validate(String input)
      Validates a given password according to specific rules. The rules include:
      • The password must not contain any whitespace.
      • The password must contain at least one of the specified pet names.
      • The password must have at least one uppercase letter.
      • The password must have at least 5 lowercase letters.
      • The password must have at least one digit.
      • The password must only contain valid upper or lower case letters and digits.
      Specified by:
      validate in interface PasswordValidatorInterface
      Parameters:
      input - Inputs the password string to be validated.
      Returns:
      A ValidationResult object indicating whether the password is valid and providing a corresponding message.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method runs the password validator in an interactive mode, prompting the user to enter a password and displaying the validation results.
      Parameters:
      args - Takes command-line arguments.
